newsitem.title: CANADA: GM Ste-Therese plant to resume production.
newsitem.headline: GM Ste-Therese plant to resume production.

text.p: General Motors of Canada said on Tuesday that it expects to resume production at its Ste-Therese plant in Boisbriand, Quebec on Thursday.
Production at the plant, which makes 400 Chevrolet Camaros and Pontiac Firebirds a day, has been halted since last Wednesday night because of a shortage of parts.
GM spokesman Marc Osborne told Reuters that new parts from the United States are expected to arrive in time to call back the plant's 1,500 production workers and resume output Thursday morning.
Production was halted and the workers were sent home after door pads, which are inserted on the inside of the car doors, sent from U.S. suppliers did not meet specifications.
The plant is located in Boisbriand, a Montreal suburb.
